Definition of Responsibilities of NAEB Committees
(NOTE - An asterisk (*) preceding any definition indicates^that it was formu¬
lated largely (and in some cases, entirely) on the basis of standards set up
by previous committee chairmen,)
AWARDS AMD CITATIONS COMMITTEE — Each year determines whether NAEB Awards and
Citations should be made, and if so to whom, for outstanding contributions to
NAEB and to the general field of educational broadcasting. Committee recommen¬
dations are subject to approval by the Board of Directors, Presentations are
made by the Committee on behalf of NAEB, The Committee shall be guided by stand¬
ards for selection, established by the Committee, and approved by the Board*
This Committee also may nominate, for consideration by the Board of Directors,
persons the committee feels worthy of Honorary Membership in NAEB, (Revised,
February 6, I960.)
CONSTITUTION COMMITTEE — This committee is responsible for keeping the NAEB
By-Laws and Constitution up-to-date, in order that these documents may reflect
the growth and interests of the Association. The committee may make recommen¬
dations for changes to the Board of Directors (either as a result of its own
deliberations or as a result of suggestions from NAEB members), or may be called
upon by the Board to prepare amendments desired by the Board, for submission to
the membership for approval, (This committee works closely with the NAEB legal
counsel.)
CONVENTION COMMITTEE — This committee, so far, has been appointed each year
on an annual basis, with members largely or wholly from the host city. Some
thought needs to be given to a pattern which would also allow more continuty,
assistance, and guidance to the host convention committee each year.
DEVELOPMENT COMMITTEE — This committee shall have as its primary concern the
development and maintenance of a firm and sound basis of support for the Asso¬
ciation. The committee shall concern itself with the long-range problems of
NAEB growth and development. It shall, in co-operation with the President and
the Board of Directors, explore new and continuing support for NAEB. It shall,
when deemed advisable, secure such support, in concert with the President and
the Board. (Revised February 6, I960.)
ENGINEERING COMMITTEE — *This committee has formulated the following statement
of objectives: A) To investigate new technical developments and ideas and their
potential application to educational broadcasting; B) To reviex* proposed FCC
rules and regulations and legislations affecting or likely to affect operations
or activities in which NAEB members are or might be engaged, and to make recom¬
mendations; C) To analyze, study and evaluate technical problems of NAEB or
Individual members and to supply advice and counsel and make recommendations
concerning their solution; D) To provide a continuing program to upgrade the
proficiency of technical personnel; E) To promote increased interest and parti-
